Posts.Title: A place to greet and meet newbies to stage III hopefour Castigame

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2015 10:22AM KSil wrote: Just to add my 2-cents, the Radiologist that initially did my ultrasound could not see anything that looked abnormal, but my BS did the ultrasound and took a biopsy of the spot where I felt a small lump (confirmed ILC). Follow-up MRI showed 2cm ILC tumor and 1-possible node. Surgery revealed a 6 cm tumor and 4 positive nodes with extracapsular extension. Ugh! This was 8-years after a double mastectomy for DCIS/LCIS with immediate tram flap reconstruction. Scary stuff, but two-years out from diagnosis, and doing well. :)
